PositiveEntailmentTest.purpose: This test highlights the different behavior of forward-chaining vs. backward-chaining engines
PositiveEntailmentTest.description: The entailment holds, but some engines may have difficulty finding it and/or may behave badly with it. This particular test case may be hard to handle for backward-chaining engines, depending on their implementation of the func:numeric-add builtin. In a forward-chaining strategy, the entailment should be found, but since the minimal model itself is infinite, a naive engine, which tries to materialize the whole minimal model may not terminate.
